Transfer of Knowledge: Reading and Creating Risk Assessment Maps Institute of Forestry and NRM, Tribhuvan University and Woodwell Climate Research Center 1 Intro Linking risk assessments to their practical use Risk assessment maps are useful and increasingly common, however the technical knowledge needed to interpret these maps is a potential barrier to widespread implementation. Using risk maps to inform climate policy requires skills in map interpretation and a baseline understanding of uncertainty inherent in climate simulations. Therefore, fostering the right skill set to correctly read and interpret maps of climate risk factors is a crucial aspect of risk science communication. To address this need, skill transfer and capacity bundling are an integral part of this study. To address this need, Woodwell Climate Research Center and School of Forestry and NRM, Tribhuvan University intend to engage with students/academics who are interested in learning the risk mapping process and the basic skills needed for interpretation. Goals of training Participants are able to work with climate model data and create their own maps and visualizations. Participants are able to communicate how climate change will impact Province 1. Participants are able to use the data to help tell their story. Learning outcome After the completion of the program, participants will be able to discuss risk maps and describe the process to their friends and community.
